title: Reflections on the development of health inequalities policy in England
abstract:
Abstracts are written to summarise documents and to whet the reader’s\ud
interest. Alas, many readers just use them as a substitute for reading the whole\ud
paper, which given the brevity of abstracts can give a somewhat distorted impression.\ud
I hope that having read this abstract, you will read on. If you do, you will find\ud
that I offer a little personal history and a little impersonal history on the development\ud
of interest in the issue of health inequalities in England. I then summarise the\ud
policy response of recent Labour administrations, briefly detail the effects of this\ud
response, and finally offer my own three-pronged policy attack on our thus far really\ud
quite stubborn inequalities in health
